content.rendered:
LET IT SNOW!

OUR FAVORITE WINTER WEDDING STYLE IDEAS

If you're planning a winter wedding, chances are you set the date before thinking about day-of attire. Looking at temps and starting to stress about what to wear if it's a chilly day? Don't! There are plenty of chic ways to stay cozy and make a serious style impact on the big day.

From fur shrugs to bow ties, scroll on for Pinterest-worthy winter wedding style ideas from our real weddings!

1. Fur Shrugs

Needing a little extra warmth but still want to look as glamorous and chic as ever?

Try a fur shrug! You can go with a snow-white, a chestnut brown or even a soft gray fur. No matter the style, brides, bridesmaids AND grooms can all rock a little fur in our book!

Photos by Kristin Vanzant, Linday Vallas, Sarah Sidwell Photography, Wind & Gold Photography, Matt Andrews, SheHeWe, and Joe Hendricks.

2. Jackets

If you're not into the fur look, it's okay! Check out these awesome looks from two of our favorite weddings.

Velvet and leather are two staple pieces that can do no wrong in the winter season! We love how it shows the personality of these cool brides.

Photos by Blue Vinyl Photography & That Wedding Ninja

3. Long Sleeves

One second while we obsess over these dainty lace sleeves...

Nothing says winter wedding like an elegant sleeve! Whether it's an off-the-shoulder, backless, or sweetheart neckline a long-sleeve is never boring.

Don't believe us? Check out these brides!

Photos by Davello Photography, Sarah Swain Photography, John Myers Photography and Cody & Allison.

4. Shoes

We can admit we have a bit of a shoe addiction, but don't we all?

Shoes are an element you definitely do not want to forget! We would highly recommend finding some that are close-toed (hello its cold out there), comfortable to dance in, and add some extra charm.

Our brides Allison and Katie sure knew how to find the perfect pair!

Photos by Rebecca Renee & Haley George Photography.

5. Bow Ties

Cue Justin Timberlake "Suit and Tie." 

A trend across almost all winter weddings is a classic black suit and bow tie for the gentlemen of the evening.

We must admit, these men do look sharp!

Photos by Sarah Sidwell Photography, John Myers Photography & Rebecca Renee.

excerpt.rendered: Five winter wedding style ideas to keep you cozy and chic on the big day.
